p:
The antibacterial activity of essential oils, especially that of the essential oil obtained from leaves, seems to be mainly related to the presence of two monoterpenes: α-pinene and β-pinene. The first is widely used in the manufacture of insecticides, sprays and disinfectants. Further, it has anti-inflammatory, antibacterial and anti-cancer properties, along with spasmolytic and skin redness properties. β-Pinene is generally used to manufacture aromatic oil and as a monomer in the production of terpene resins; moreover, it has anti-inflammatory and antibacterial activity. Both monoterpenes (α- and β-pinene) have antimicrobial activity against Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria, especially Escherichia coli, Staphylococcus bacteria
53, 54 , Staphylococcus aureus and Bacillus subtilis
55, 56 .
